txt.en: Steely-eyed brigands leap to defend their encampment
'Search the bandit camp'
Stolen Mementos
Denjâri bandits defeated ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
'TBD you did it'
Search for clues as to the armour's whereabouts

'One would think my noble title as patriarch of House Ghôlkhas would grant me speedy audience with the Kindred, but it appears I was mistaken. Would you consider my request instead?

'A suit of my predecessor's ceremonial armour was pilfered from the family mausoleum. My servants have heard tell of a shameless group of brigands known as the Denjâri boasting of such a piece somewhere in Tâkhdar.

'If you investigate these claims, you would have my gratitude and patronage.'
'TBD Search for clues'
Speak with Rashâm in Kheb Hanût
Search for clues as to the armour's whereabouts
Rashâm should be here somewhere
'TBD Search camp for clues'
'TBD Enter bandit camp'
Defeat Denjâri bandits.
'TBD Find Fence in the black market'

'I hope you are here to buy, stranger. I have more sundry than I care to offload at present.\n\n'Zulkhêma of the Denjâri? Did she sell me a peculiar set of armour, you ask? I might know that name, and I might even know the armour. I have recently come into possession of a great many pieces of treasure. I hardly know what to do with them all; I may have paid more than their worth.'
'TBD Search for clues'
Speak with Rashâm in Kheb Hanût.
Look for Rashâm in the black market of Kheb Hanût
The patriarch of the Ghôlkhas noble family has asked you to retrieve a set of armour stolen from his family during the days of the Heirs of Castamir.
You found a letter: the stolen armour was sold to a black market fence named Rashâm
Defeat Denjâri bandits ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Search the bandit camp for the Ghôlkhas patriarch's armour
Rashâm can be found in the black market of Kheb Hanût.\n\nA letter from the Denjâri bandits' leader says she has sold the Ghôlkhas's stolen armour to a black market fence named Rashâm.

Bandits tend to lurk in north-west Tâkhdar.\n\nOkhtâr Ghôlkhas, head of a prominent family, has asked you to retrieve heirloom armour a group of bandits called the Denjâri stole from the family tomb. He has asked you to retrieve it.
'TBD - Desc'

'The Denjâri bandits did not frighten you away, did they? I cannot blame you if they did; I myself would be terrified! Ha! But this is why I will be paying you so well, no? Please return to me with news of my armour!'

'My servants have all said the Denjâri bandits, and many others, spend their days in Takhdâr. I do not ask my servants how they know such things, as their history is more interesting as a mystery. It helps me keep my sense of adventure without dirtying my silk clothing!'
